message:
Ensure that the bucket policy allows only the necessary operations (AWS Security Best Practices, Control 2.2): Restrict the actions allowed by the bucket policy to the minimum necessary. URL: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/using-iam-policies.html

Enable MFA delete for the bucket (CIS AWS Foundations, Control 3.2.1): Require multi-factor authentication (MFA) for object deletion. URL: https://d0.awsstatic.com/whitepapers/compliance/AWS_CIS_Foundations_Benchmark.pdf

Enable server-side encryption for all objects stored in the bucket (NIST SP 800-53, Control SC-28): Implement server-side encryption using AWS S3 Server-Side Encryption (SSE). URL: https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-53r5.pdf

Use AWS Key Management Service (KMS) for server-side encryption (AWS Security Best Practices, Control 4.2): Use AWS KMS to manage encryption keys used for server-side encryption in S3. URL: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/UsingKMSEncryption.html

Enable AWS CloudTrail for S3 bucket (AWS Security Best Practices, Control 5.1): Enable AWS CloudTrail to capture API calls for the S3 bucket. URL: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/awscloudtrail/latest/userguide/cloudtrail-s3-bucket.html

Enable Amazon S3 server access logging (AWS Security Best Practices, Control 5.2): Enable server access logging for the S3 bucket to monitor and audit bucket access. URL: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/ServerLogs.html

Monitor S3 buckets using Amazon CloudWatch (AWS Security Best Practices, Control 5.3): Use CloudWatch to monitor and detect unauthorized access or changes to S3 buckets. URL: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/logs/CWL_GettingStarted.html

Enable Amazon S3 bucket versioning (AWS Security Best Practices, Control 5.4): Enable versioning for the S3 bucket to protect against accidental deletion of objects. URL: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/ObjectVersioning.html

Implement data lifecycle policies (AWS Security Best Practices, Control 5.5): Define lifecycle policies to automate the transition and deletion of objects in the S3 bucket. URL: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/object-lifecycle-mgmt.html

Control access to the S3 bucket using bucket policies (AWS Security Best Practices, Control 7.1): Use bucket policies to control access to the S3 bucket and enforce security requirements. URL: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/using-iam-policies.html

Monitor S3 bucket policies for changes (AWS Security Best Practices, Control 7.2): Monitor changes to bucket policies to detect unauthorized modifications. URL: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/awscloudtrail/latest/userguide/cloudtrail-s3-bucket.html

Enable AWS Security Hub for S3 bucket (AWS Security Best Practices, Control 7.3): Enable AWS Security Hub to provide a comprehensive view of security alerts and compliance status for the S3 bucket. URL: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/awssecurityhub/latest/userguide/securityhub-standards-fsbp-controls.html

Implement VPC Endpoint (NIST SP 800-53, Control SC-7): Configure and use a VPC endpoint for accessing S3 to avoid exposing the bucket to the internet. URL: https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-53r5.pdf

List security controls for Amazon S3 based on guidelines from CIS, NIST, AWS Security Best Practices, and STIGs. Use direct imperative commands, focusing on access management, encryption, monitoring, and network controls. For each control, include the specific source and a URL for direct access to additional details. Omit introductions, conclusions, comments, and warnings about content limitations.

Examples:

Implement the principle of least privilege for IAM permissions (AWS Security Best Practices): Ensure IAM policies for S3 are restricted to necessary operations. URL: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/best-practices.html

Enable Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for object deletion (CIS AWS Foundations): Require multi-factor authentication to delete objects. URL: https://d0.awsstatic.com/whitepapers/compliance/AWS_CIS_Foundations_Benchmark.pdf

Enable server-side encryption for all objects stored in S3 (NIST Special Publication 800-53): Use AWS S3 SSE to protect data at rest. URL: https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-53r5.pdf

Use policies to enforce encryption on upload (AWS Security Best Practices): Configure bucket policies to reject unencrypted object uploads. URL: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/using-iam-policies.html
